> build is failing with compilation error:

Thanks for pointing this out, I was not done addressing all comments nor completed the implementation yet last night, will continue today.

I just ran the simple benchmark with checkpointing off and checkpointing set to the same as the commit interval (10 seconds). Oddly (probably just other stuff going on) the 3 runs with checkpointing on had better throughput than the three without.

Throughput without checkpointing:
20.78 MB/s, 23.51 MB/s, 23.54 MB/s

Throughput with checkpointing:
27.13 MB/s, 28.47 MB/s, 24.48 MB/s

Based on this small sample my assumption is that overhead of checkpointing is negligible. The overhead would increase as the number of stores increases, but these are tiny files.

I kicked off a new build with the same params as build 187 and it passed: https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder-2/188/
I think this is ready for review, cc @junrao @hachikuji

For the sake of argument, I wonder if it would be sufficient to improve the regex. I get the point that users could put arbitrary text below the first line, but it would still have to pass committer review to be checked in. For example, maybe we could add "http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0" to the regex? 

Also, if we decide this is a good idea, we should probably do the same thing for the scala and python code.

I read through KAFKA-4039. Does this PR (and that JIRA) only apply for when the broker itself initiates shutdown (like during error scenarios that it self-detects)? Does this same mechanism also apply if an operator initiates a controlled shutdown (by using the kafka-server-stop.sh script)?

If the shutdown is initiated via SIGTERM, then a JVM thread starts the `exit` procedure and the Kafka shutdown hook is eventually invoked which calls KafkaServer.shutdown(). In such cases, deadlocks are less likely because we avoid the two problems addressed by this PR: calling System.exit() with locks held or while blocking a thread from termination (due to closed latch or joined thread). Does that make sense?

Good to see some progress on KIP-4! One question - does this allow new topics to be created with the cluster defaults for number of partitions and replication factor? Having to have a priori knowledge of those configs on the client is a big pain point for us using AdminUtils and I thought the elimination of that requirement was a goal.

cc @ijuma 

I ran into a couple issues with up-conversion when working with EoS message format changes. Seems we should be a little safer with the handling of NO_TIMESTAMP_TYPE.
@ewencp Thanks for the check-in. I just noticed that the checked in code has the upgrade notes under "Notable changes in 0.10.2.0" while I think we agreed to put it in 0.10.3.0.

@ijuma @ewencp @jjkoshy @radai-rosenblatt I have manually tested it successfully using the `./bin/kafka-purge-data.sh` in the patch. I am going to add unit test and probably ducktape integration test as well. But the core code should be ready for review. Would you have time to review the patch?

@ewencp I ran the offset validation tests 5 times here: https://jenkins.confluent.io/view/All/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder-2/191/console. There was no recurrence of the specific failure that this patch is targeting. The two other failures are difficult to understand and do not seem to fit with the event output. If the changes here seem reasonable, I suggest we merge this patch for the increased logging visibility, and I can continue investigating the other failures.

Oh, I almost forgot. One of the test failures seems to have been caused by this:
```
[INFO  - 2017-02-01 19:02:37,216 - background_thread - _protected_worker - lineno:39]: Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/var/lib/jenkins/workspace/system-test-kafka-branch-builder-2/kafka/venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ducktape-0.6.0-py2.7.egg/ducktape/services/
background_thread.py", line 35, in _protected_worker
    self._worker(idx, node)
  File "/var/lib/jenkins/workspace/system-test-kafka-branch-builder-2/kafka/tests/kafkatest/services/verifiable_consumer.py", line 169, in _worker
    log_config = self.render('tools_log4j.properties', log_file=VerifiableConsumer.LOG_FILE)
  File "/var/lib/jenkins/workspace/system-test-kafka-branch-builder-2/kafka/venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ducktape-0.6.0-py2.7.egg/ducktape/template.py", line 90, in render
    template = self.template_env.get_template(path)
AttributeError: 'VerifiableConsumer' object has no attribute 'template_env'
```
@onurkaraman Good catch, somehow missed this despite re-reviewing the changes. Filed https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/2484 and reopened the JIRA to adjust the docs.
